### Phishing actors exploit complex routing and misconfigurations to spoof domains


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


Phishing actors are increasingly exploiting advanced routing techniques and configuration errors to impersonate legitimate domains and deceive users. The article highlights how these threat actors manipulate Domain Name System (DNS) settings and exploit flaws in routing protocols to conduct targeted phishing attacks. By spoofing domains, they create convincing fake websites to harvest sensitive information from unsuspecting victims. The issue is compounded by widespread misconfigurations and vulnerabilities in domain management, which these actors exploit to enhance the credibility of their spoofed domains.
